text: Dear Johnathan, I want to do encryption in chain code invoke. Is it possible? (I want to use our own public/private key) Thank you.
(Actually, we try to encrypt data according to different users)
It seems like we cannot access our own private/public key outside the docker container ...
Hi Alan, that’s a pretty generic question (so keep in mind that I don’t have all the details, ) but it is possible.
(First, you can still map from a container to the file system)
The main question is how `dynamic` does it have to be. Can you pre-agree on some shared secret, or something that will be used for bootstrapping?
This will simplify things a lot for you (esp. in v0.6)

Actually what I want to do is that .... A send a data "XYZ" to B. I only want B to view. So, I try to encrypt "XYZ" using B's public Key.  Indeed, we need to send to many more different users for different messages too. The fact is (1) I can't find ways to map to local file system to use our own-defined key pairs (2) (we tried this as alternative) we try to get ECert for B. But we cannot extract the public/private Key from B's ECert.    Any advice?
<@U11MANG9G>  yes i am referring roles as admin, bank, dba etc.
Yup. Got you.
<@U2UU1LKTR|jonathan.tan> has joined the channel
<@U11MANG9G> is the 'auditor' role currently implemented ?

<@U11MANG9G> - Hi, I'm getting "ERRO : system error Error reading attribute value 'Invalid attribute position. Received [0]'" error when i'm trying to read attribute from TCert using ReadCertAttribute(). I've an attribute configured in the membersrvc.yaml.  Have you seen this issue before. Thanks.
<@U2TUCLGRJ|ahmedelhajji> has joined the channel

<@U24M29R4G|nikileshsa> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/nikileshsa/F32S2UZGR/crit_059_failed_creating_new_peer_with_handler_security_helper_not_provided.sh|CRIT 059 Failed creating new peer with handler Security helper not provided> and commented: I am trying to see if I can enable Security in pre Fabric v1 by setting the 'enabled: true' under 'Security' in the core.yaml file and I am getting a CRIT error as shown in the logs. Is there a way to enable membership services in the latest master branch.

initial_comment.comment: I am trying to see if I can enable Security in pre Fabric v1 by setting the 'enabled: true' under 'Security' in the core.yaml file and I am getting a CRIT error as shown in the logs. Is there a way to enable membership services in the latest master branch.

text: I am basically trying to see if we can enable security for some chaincode to work with in the  skeletal end to end environment for deploying and invoking transactions..in pre fabric 1.0
<@U2QQYUGKS|jappwilson> has joined the channel
i always receive a "Failed Retrieving Extension" error when i try to do something like this
callerRole, err := stub.ReadCertAttribute("role")
I do send the Tcert as part of the request body
any pointers on how to resolve this
<@U0STZRN0Y|vijayr24> has joined the channel

Hi, can I replace the Ecert in membership service with another cert(from other external authorized CA) ? If yes, is it a must to restart the membership service to make it effective? Because we should never switch off the membership service... right? Thanks.
